messages.content: {"mitigated_clause":"The Licensee shall pay to the Licensor a royalty of 5% of Net Sales of the Licensed Products, payable quarterly within 30 days after the end of each calendar quarter. The royalty shall be capped at $500,000 per year. The royalty shall be adjusted annually based on changes in CPI not to exceed 3% per year. Late payments shall bear interest at 1.5% per month, and a default interest of 3% per month shall apply after 60 days of delinquency."}

### Summary
- **Risk Score:** 68/100
- **Key Risk Drivers:** uncapped royalty amount, vague payment timing.
- **Mitigation Suggestion:** add a yearly cap of $500,000, limit CPI adjustments to 3% per year, and include a default interest clause for payments overdue more than 60 days.
